                  int fl = 1;
                  for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
                      if (vec[i][0] < vec[j][0] && vec[i][1] < vec[j][1] && vec[i][2] < vec[j][2]) {
                          fl = 0;
                          break; // optional: break early if possible?
                      }
                  }
                  if (fl == 1) {
                      if (vec[i][3] < ansprice) {
                          ansprice = vec[i][3];
                          ans = i + 1;
                      }
                  }
              }
              // Now ans is the output of the first program.

                  // convert i to string and append to s
                  char num[5];
                  sprintf(num, "%d", i);
                  int len = strlen(num);
                  for (int j = 0; j < len; j++) {
                      s[pos++] = num[j];
                  }
              }
              s[pos] = '\0'; // null terminate, though we are going to index by ans-1

              // Now output the character at index ans-1 (since the Java program uses 0-indexed array and we generated the string in the same way).
              printf("%c\n", s[ans-1]);

              return 0;
          }
